children: A 47-year-old woman is evaluated for an 18-month history of dry eyes, dry mouth, and a change in the shape of her face, as
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is Sjögren syndrome. This patient has parotid gland enlargement that is beginning to obscure her ears on frontal view. Nearly 50% of patients with Sjögren syndrome develop symmetric salivary gland enlargement that is most obvious in the parotid glands but may also involve the submandibular glands.

objective.__html: Diagnose parotid and salivary gland swelling associated with Sjögren syndrome.
